text:
New Tomcat 5.0.9 "normal" installation, Tomcat Web Server - Administration tool:
1) Click on tree root "Tomcat server": Ok
2) Click on "Service (Catalina)": Ok
3) Click on "Host (Localhost)": in the right frameset I see this error:



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
HTTP Status 500 - Error retrieving attribute liveDeploy
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"type": Status report

"message": Error retrieving attribute liveDeploy

"description": The server encountered an internal error (Error retrieving
attribute liveDeploy) that prevented it from fulfilling this request.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
creator: dario.bonino@rgi.it
dario.bonino@rgi.it
text:
Created attachment 8072
web error screen capture

creator: remm@apache.org
text: Q: Did you read the release notes ? I suppose not ;-)

creator: dario.bonino@rgi.it
text:
http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/tomcat-5.0-doc/RELEASE-NOTES.txt ??
I can't see anything usefull ... nothing alse:
"When all else fails: See the FAQ http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/faq/"
I don't found nothing.

Ok, this is not a bugs or is a fixed bug,
however can you be more accurate and help me plese?

Thanks.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Please do not reopen the report, the issue has been addressed.

------------------------------
Administration web application:
------------------------------

Due to changes in the configuration file format, the administration web 
application does not support editing hosts or connectors. This will be 
resolved in a future Tomcat beta release.

I read the web site docs instead of local installed docs.
Sorry and Thanks.
creator: dario.bonino@rgi.it
vaught_gl@adelphia.net
text:
I am using Tomcat 5.0.9 on XP Pro and I do not have this problem, but I do on 
Win 2K Pro and Server. Can you explain the difference. I have read the local 
release notes under the Welcome and this says nothing useful as Dario pointed 
out. Would you kindly point out the section that addresses this issue for Win2K 
Pro/Server?

creator: amyroh@apache.org
text:
This shouldn't be OS dependent.  The bug was due to the fact that admin webapp
hadn't been updated to reflect new Host attributes.  I suggest to use the later
build (5.0.12 - beta soon) which has a fix.

I did try installing the 5.0.12 and had the same problem. However, I did 
install over 5.0.9. Can you upgrade this way or is better to uninstall the 
previous version first? I will try uninstalling 5.0.9, clean the registry and 
then install 5.0.12.

It is weird that XP Professional works beautifully with 5.0.9 with no problems. 
Maybe I was just lucky.
creator: vaught_gl@adelphia.net
